abstract.p: Standard Chartered PLC will pay $1.32 billion in cash to buy Chase Manhattan Corp's Hong Kong credit card and retail banking division; acquisition will make Standard Chartered biggest credit card provider in Hong Hong with one-quarter of market; will finance acquisition by issuing 50 million new shares at 915 pence and by selling British subsidiary to Lloyds/TBS for 627 million pounds (S)

block.p: Continuing a recent buying spree in Asia, where it earns two- thirds of its income, Standard Chartered P.L.C. said it would pay $1.32 billion in cash to buy the Chase Manhattan Corporation's Hong Kong credit card and retail banking division. The acquisition would make Standard Chartered the biggest credit card provider in Hong Kong with one- quarter of the market. The British-based bank said it would finance the acquisition by issuing 50 million new shares at 915 pence and by selling a British subsidiary to Lloyds/TSB for $:627 million. Standard Chartered's shares rose 1 pence, to 955 pence.
